text: General thought.
author: simonathibault

text: I feel like this is an answer for @annhui
author: simonathibault

text: When the yuzu go on sale THAT is when I will be envious.
author: simonathibault

text: Carrying your canvas bags brings me joy, as does gifting them.
author: simonathibault

text: But I want to say thank you to all those who view hospitality as something both subtle and gross, normalized and politicized. I see you. People see you. You matter.
author: simonathibault

text: This is not to denigrate uber-queer spaces. They are to be celebrated. But when it’s the unexpected joint, the neighbourhood spot that has made changes to make the space accommodating to those in need it is a thing of beauty. Queer people see this and appreciate it.
author: simonathibault

text: There is something to be said for a subtly queer food space. The markers are there if you know how/where to look/listen(And it’s ok if you don’t recognize them, you’ll feel the positive impact). Like how staff don’t use gendered pronouns & queer codes used/displayed by staff.
author: simonathibault

text: Thanks ! It’s an adaptation of a recipe from @wednesdaychef
author: simonathibault

text: Grey days like this remind me of why I put up so much fruit in the summer. So  I can pretend, for a minute, that’s it’s summer in my kitchen when I make stuff like this. Gooseberry verbena jam streusel cake. Spelt and whole wheat crust, buckwheat streusel. #flourasflavour
author: simonathibault

text: Best form of self-care
author: simonathibault

text: Yup. Still at it.
author: simonathibault

text: Use mushroom stock/dashi for your liquid. Poached or soft boiled egg. Pickled ginger to cut through richness. Togarashi for heat.
author: simonathibault

text: Savoury is the best. So good
author: simonathibault

text: Many thanks to @NinaWest and @Mercedesiman for sharing their stories. Being true to oneself removes the otherness we feel and shows the courage we need/have today. #DragRace
author: simonathibault

text: This.
author: simonathibault

text: Nowruz Mubarak! Bring on the tahdig!
author: simonathibault

text: With tomorrow being Nowruz (Persian New Year), I am craving kuku sabzi. And bless Andy Baraghani for showing people how it's made.
author: simonathibault

text: Tonight is the start of Purim, and tomorrow is Nowruz. My kingdom for hammantaschen and kuku sabzi. Does anyone in #halifax make hammantaschen ? I'll be making the kuku sabzi.
author: simonathibault

text: Recent trip home. "Oui, j'ai marrié une savaugesse de derrière Weymouth." This person was talking about their wife.
author: simonathibault

text: I was craving kuku sabzi after hearing you talk to @Francis_Lam on @SplendidTable and I wondered when Nowruz was happening...
author: simonathibault

text: In Korea its often related/relegated to Gengis Khan, and is known as his mark.
author: simonathibault

text: You know it's a good Monday when you let your eggs cool a bit too much, your coffee isn't perfect and you still feel like it's a good day where a lot of good things can happen.
author: simonathibault

text: *cough* recipe tester *cough*
author: simonathibault

text: To all of you thinking of having a big bowl of a certain leprechaun-themed cereal today? Look up said brand of cereal and gastrointestinal distress. Green poop is real.
author: simonathibault

text: And those Qs made me think: My parents rappie pie (which they always make together), eating peaches in the orchard and remembering my sister being happy to have her sense of taste return, and my Mom and Dad and I eating salt fish, and living in the now.
author: simonathibault

text: I listened to @CiaoSamin answer not in a glib manner, but as an example of a concerned effort to take care of herself. A Communal Table is a place to both take up space and accommodate others. To practice hospitality. And @kittenwithawhip does this.
author: simonathibault

text: Fave bit of @foodandwine 's podcast, Communal Table w/ @kittenwithawhip is asking what is your comfort food, the last meal that made you emotional, & the last meal that someone cooked for you in their home? Qs as reflexes of reminding you what can matter.
author: simonathibault
